ai.summary: Heritage 100 - Walridge Fell is an 8.9 km ridge-focused hike in the UK, offering exposed summits, sweeping views, and a moderate challenge for hikers with some experience on rocky terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows rugged ridgelines with rocky paths, heather moorland, and occasional boggy patches. Expect exposure to wind and weather; navigation and steady footing are important on the exposed sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight before starting; the ridge sections are exposed and can be windy. Bring a map and compass or a GPS device, and know how to use them. Stay on marked paths, watch footing on rocky or boggy ground, and avoid loose rock. Inform someone of your plan and expected return. Carry sufficient water and food, a charged phone in case of emergencies, a weather-appropriate layer, hat and gloves, and a compact first aid kit. In poor visibility, consider turning back.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Fully charged phone and emergency contact method
Water bottle or hydration system, snacks
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn, roughly Marchâ€“October; conditions are most reliable then, though the route can be hiked year-round with extra precautions in winter.

seo.title: Heritage 100 - Walridge Fell: UK Ridge Hike (8.9 km)
